figgy.title: There's a local fixity event whose affected_resource is nil

comments.body:
this one took about 10min to run

```
figgy_production=# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM orm_resources a JOIN orm_resources b ON ((a.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID = (b.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID) WHERE a.internal_resource = 'Event' AND a.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND b.internal_resource = 'Event' AND b.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND a.id != b.id;
 count 
-------
 10424
(1 row)
```

(note this query counts every pair twice)

Here are the earliest and latest incidents of the duplication on production
```
figgy_production=# SELECT a.created_at, b.created_at FROM orm_resources a JOIN orm_resources b ON ((a.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID = (b.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID) WHERE a.internal_resource = 'Event' AND a.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND b.internal_resource = 'Event' AND b.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND a.created_at < b.created_at AND a.id != b.id ORDER BY b.created_at ASC LIMIT 1;                

         created_at         |         created_at         
----------------------------+----------------------------
 2019-11-16 21:01:06.392547 | 2020-01-11 21:01:20.597917
(1 row)
```
```
figgy_production=# SELECT a.created_at, b.created_at FROM orm_resources a JOIN orm_resources b ON ((a.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID = (b.metadata->'resource_id'->0->>'id')::UUID) WHERE a.internal_resource = 'Event' AND a.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND b.internal_resource = 'Event' AND b.metadata @> '{"type":["cloud_fixity"],"current":[true],"child_property":["metadata_node"]}' AND a.created_at < b.created_at AND a.id != b.id ORDER BY b.created_at DESC LIMIT 1;
          created_at         |         created_at         
----------------------------+----------------------------
 2021-10-17 21:04:29.029757 | 2023-07-29 21:30:42.067533
```

figgy.title: Prevent deletion of EphemeraTerm if used in EphemeraFolder
Do not allow an ephemera term to be deleted if it is used by a folder
Preserve everything that's not already preserved.
Do not allow deletion of vocabularies with members
A recovered ephemera vocabulary should recover its terms

comments.body: Vocabularies do behave like collections, and as such, they should not be deletable if they're not empty. Just like a collection.

figgy.title: Metadata nodes not staying in sync with preservation storage.

comments.body:
Cleaned these up and resolved. Some notes:

1. Some of the events referenced preservation objects and resources that no longer exist
2. Some of the events were fixed using RepairCloudFixityJob
3. The rest were fixed by forcing re-preservation

In total, there were 150 current cloud fixity failure events

figgy.title: Add unique index for metadata events per resource id

comments.body:
I think this is a good idea, and will probably prevent what's likely a race condition.

Some things to think about:

1. We're logically replication lib-postgres3 to figgy-db-prod1 right now - running this won't create the index on figgy-db-prod1 (schema doesn't replicate)
2. When we make this index, we probably want to make it CONCURRENTLY, so it doesn't lock the db.

pdc_describe.title: Move preservation S3 bucket to a different zone

comments.body:
Now that the system has been configured to save the preservation files in a different bucket (`pdc-describe-prod-preservation`) on a different availability zone (`us-west-1`) I re-ran the preservation rake task on the one record in production to make sure the preservation files (`princeton-data-commons/...`) are saved in the new location. 

```
$ bundle exec rake works:preserve[40,"10.11578/1366453/40"]
```

![preservation](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_describe/assets/568286/b3c37469-f4ed-48da-b35d-0bb31dd41ff5)

I also manually deleted them from the old location so that they are not visible through Globus to outside users.

![postcuration](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_describe/assets/568286/42b122db-fbee-4935-9cfc-92138a800a6c)

@kconnellmail We updated the software to put the processing in the background.  It has been running now for 30 minutes.  It was never going to complete in the time a web request allows...

The following `agents` have been created for `pdc-describe-prod` using `princeton_ansible`:

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5b5b6aed981c3204c9ed06c8/96ad4ec7-c61b-4367-88f3-1590b71deaa9)
There exists no accompanying `proxy` for these, I shall evaluate and look to create this now.

From what I could best determine, `proxy` entities are created automatically from status checks invoked from the `backend`:

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5b5b6aed981c3204c9ed06c8/e7291c6a-aa22-4e62-a5f4-78dea25dbc3c)
perhaps add a retry, but we will wait to see if we see this more often before changing the code

princeton_ansible.title: [lib_jobs] Check out working copy of SVN EADs repo

comments.body:
Of possible relevance:

The red-bean SVN book has helpful information on credentials caching here: https://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.4/svn.serverconfig.netmodel.html#svn.serverconfig.netmodel.credcache

More expansive draft version for 1.8: https://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.8/svn.serverconfig.netmodel.html#svn.serverconfig.netmodel.creds

This blog explains the use of a config file with `ssh`: https://highlevelbits.com/2007/04/svn-over-ssh-prompts-for-wrong-username.html

- Where should these files end up? 
- Should we check out from different servers based on the environment? (i.e. on prod use `svn://lib-svn-prod1.princeton.edu/libsvn/trunk/eads` and on staging use `svn://lib-svn-staging1.princeton.edu/libsvn/trunk/eads`)
- Are we sure that we only need to do this once per server? Should we just check that there's a "trunk" directory in whatever directory we want to put it, and if there's already one, skip the task?
